text: I think that we ill prepare athletes
from the very beginning from the the
moment they pick up a ball or kick it or
whatever it is they're doing we ill
prepare them um especially with the
major sports what you see is this cycle
of entitlement uh that gets thrown their
way so you know the kid who's in junior
high and hasn't finished his test but
still gets to play because he's an
athlete fails a test and still gets to
play because they're an athlete um gets
to get away with not doing chores at
home because they've got practice all
these types of things build up and then
in college I love college and I and I
think you know many colleges aren't as
good as the one that I went to in terms
of taking care of the whole athlete and
they focus on weightlifting and practice
and and academically they just let you
get by you know I went to Penn State
nobody was allowed to just get by you
know they wanted academical Americans if
they could have them but that's not the
case everywhere and then you get to be a
pro and all of a
sudden a lot of things are possible for
you that are impossible for anybody
else you know the the fact is
that you know I've been stopped more
than a handful of times by the police
for driving just a little bit too fast
and I've never had a ticket in this
country never had a ticket because I've
signed plenty of tickets for police
officers but I have haven't actually
been given a ticket so all of a sudden
if you're not careful this feeling comes
over you that you are a bit omnipotent
and you can do anything and this is a
really dangerous combination once the
agulation
stops it's really
dangerous paired with that and I think
maybe even more important is the fact
that when I played basketball I never
thought I was a basketball player I
played basketball I was a man who played
basketball and after I played basketball
and before I play basketball I was going
to be a
psychologist whereas most people who
play their occupation is their
definition and then when they stop doing
who they
are they become
nothing and that's when you see so many
of these problems where they're
desperate to try and find a new way to
be relevant even to
themselves so this combination of
entitlement and then the fact that when
your career is over you stop being
relevant even to yourself is Just Deadly
we've got to educate athletes not only
in the pros with great programs that
need to be implemented but in college
and in high school and even before
